text: And Solomon the son of David strengthened himself concerning his kingdom, and Yahweh his God was with him and made him exceedingly great.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to all the leaders for all Israel, the heads of the families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon and the whole assembly with him went to the high place that was at Gibeon, for the tent of assembly of God that Moses the servant of Yahweh had made in the desert was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But the ark of God David had brought up from Kiriath-Jearim to the place David had prepared for it, for David had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bronze altar that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made was there before the tabernacle of Yahweh. And Solomon and the assembly sought it out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon went up there to the bronze altar before Yahweh, which was at the tent of assembly, and he offered upon it a thousand burnt offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that night God appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask what I shall give to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon said to God, “You yourself have shown steadfast loyal love to David my father and have made me king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, O Yahweh God, let your word to David my father be fulfilled, for you yourself have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, give to me wisdom and knowledge that I may go out and come in before this people, for who can judge this, your great people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said to Solomon, “Because this was with your heart and you did not ask for wealth, possessions, honor, and the lives of your enemies, and also did not ask for long life, but have asked for wisdom and knowledge that you might judge my people over whom I have made you king,
speaker: Narrator

text: wisdom and knowledge is given to you. And I will also give to you wealth, possessions, and honor, the like of which was not had by the kings who were before you, nor will there be the like after you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon went from the high place which was at Gibeon to Jerusalem before the tent of assembly. And he reigned over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen. And he had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, and he placed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king made silver and gold in Jerusalem like the stones. And he made cedar as abundant as the sycamore fig trees that were in the Shephelah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue. The traders of the king received them from Kue at a price.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went up and exported a chariot from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver and a horse for one hundred and fifty shekels. And these were likewise exported to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon planned to build a house for the name of Yahweh and a royal palace for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon assigned seventy thousand men to bear burdens and eighty thousand quarriers in the hill country, and three thousand six hundred men to supervise them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon sent word to Huram king of Tyre, saying, “As you have dealt with David my father and sent cedar to him to build for himself a house in which to live, please deal with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look, I am building a house for the name of Yahweh my God to dedicate to him, to offer sweet spices of incense before him, and for the regular rows of bread, and burnt offerings for mornings, evenings, Sabbaths, and new moon festivals, and for appointed feasts of Yahweh our God which are everlasting for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house that I am building will be great, for our God is greater than all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now who indeed has adequate strength to build a house for him? For the heavens and the highest heavens are not able to contain him. Now who am I that I would build a house for him, except to burn incense before him?
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, send to me skilled men to work with gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and with purple, crimson, and blue fabric, knowledgeable in engraving, with the skilled men who are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father has established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send me trees of cedar, cypress, and algum from Lebanon, for I myself know that your servants are knowledgeable in cutting the trees of Lebanon. Now see, my servants will be with your servants
speaker: Narrator

text: to prepare trees in abundance for me, for the house that I am building will be great and wonderful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now see, I will provide twenty thousand dry measures of crushed wheat, twenty thousand dry measures of barley, twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil to the woodcarvers and those who cut timber.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Huram king of Tyre answered in a letter, and he sent word to Solomon: “Because Yahweh loves his people, he has made you king over them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Huram said, “Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who has made the heavens and the earth, who has given to King David a wise son knowing discretion and understanding, who will build for Yahweh a house and a royal palace for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now I have sent a skilled man, knowledgeable and with understanding: my master Huram,
speaker: Narrator

text: a son of a woman from the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre, knowledgeable for working with gold, silver, bronze, iron, stone, and wood, and with purple, blue, and crimson fabric, and with fine linen, for engraving any engraving and devising any plan that is given to him, with your skilled men and the skilled men of my lord David your father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as for the wheat, barley, oil, and wine that my lord mentioned, let him send that to his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we ourselves will cut trees from Lebanon according to all your need, and we will bring them to you on rafts over the sea to Joppa, so that you may bring them up to Jerusalem.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon counted all the resident alien men who were in the land of Israel after the census that David his father had taken of them. And there were found one hundred and fifty-three thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed from them seventy thousand to bear burdens, eighty thousand to quarry in the hill country, and three thousand six hundred overseers to make the people work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon began to build the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem, on Mount Moriah, where Yahweh had appeared to David his father, at the place that David had established, on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to build in the second month of the fourth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were the measurements of Solomon for building the house of God: the length in cubits by the former measurement was sixty cubits, and the width was twenty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the portico that was in front was the same as the front of the width of the house: twenty cubits. And its height was one hundred and twenty cubits. And he overlaid it on the inside with pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the great house itself he covered with cypress wood, then he overlaid it with pure gold. And he put on it palm tree images and ornate chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he overlaid the house with precious stone as decoration. (Now the gold was the gold of Parvaim.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the house with gold—the beams, the thresholds, the walls, and the doors. And he carved cherubim upon the walls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the most holy place. Its length was equal to the width of the house: twenty cubits. And its breadth was twenty cubits. And he overlaid it with six hundred talents of fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the weight for the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid its upper rooms with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two sculpted wood cherubim in the most holy place, and he overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the outstretched wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits; one wing of five cubits touched the wall of the house, and the other wing of five cubits was touching the outstretched wing of the other cherub.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the wing of five cubits of the other cherub was touching the wall of the house, and its other wing five cubits long touching the wing of the first cherub.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wings of these cherubim extended twenty cubits, and they were standing on their feet, their faces toward the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the curtain of blue and purple and crimson and fine linen, and put cherubim on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the front of the house he made two columns, thirty-five cubits high, and the capital on their top was five cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made decorative chains in the inner sanctuary and put them on top of the columns. And he made one hundred pomegranate ornaments, and put them on the chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he erected the columns in front of the temple, one on the south and one on the north. He called the name of the southern one Jakin, and the name of the northern one Boaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made an altar of bronze, twenty cubits was its length, and twenty cubits was its width, and ten cubits was its height.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the sea of molten metal, from brim to brim it was ten cubits, completely round. And it was five cubits in height, and its circumference measured thirty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Under it were figures of oxen all around it, ten cubits high, encircling the sea all around. The oxen were in two rows cast as one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was standing upon twelve oxen, three facing north, and three facing west, and three facing south, and three facing east. The sea was set upon them from above, and all their hindquarters faced inward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And its thickness was a handbreadth, and its brim was like the working of the lip of a cup, the blossom of a lily. And it held three thousand baths.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten basins. And he set five on the south and five on the north in which to wash; they washed off the work of the burnt offering in them, but the sea was for the priests to wash therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten golden lampstands according to their custom, and he set them in the temple, five on the south and five on the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten tables and placed them in the temple, five on the south and five on the north. And he made a hundred drinking bowls of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the courtyard of the priests and the great outer courtyard and the doors for the outer court. And he overlaid their doors with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the sea at the southeast corner of the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huram made the pots, the shovels, and the drinking bowls. So Hiram finished making the work that he made on the house of God for King Solomon:
speaker: Narrator

text: the two columns, the bowls, and the two capitals on top of the columns, and the two latticeworks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on top of the columns,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two latticeworks, two rows of pomegranates for the latticework, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were before the columns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the water carts, and he made the basins on the water carts,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the one sea and the twelve oxen underneath it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huram-abi made for King Solomon the pots, the shovels, the three-pronged meat forks, and all the utensils of polished bronze for the house of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king cast them in the plain of the Jordan, in the clay soil between Succoth and Zeredah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon made all these utensils in great abundance, for the weight of the bronze could not be determined.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon made all the objects that were in the house of God: the altar of gold; the tables upon which was the bread of the presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the lampstands, and the lamps for burning according to the custom before the inner sanctuary, of solid gold;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the blossoms, the lamps, and the tongs that were of solid gold;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the snuffers, the drinking bowls, the dishes, and the firepans, of solid gold; and the entrance to the house, the inner doors to the most holy place, and the doors to the house of the temple were of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the work that Solomon did for the house of Yahweh was finished, Solomon brought the holy objects of David his father: the silver, the gold, and all the objects he had put into the storehouses of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon assembled all the elders of Israel and all the heads of the tribes, the leaders of the families for the Israelites, to Jerusalem in order to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh from the city of David, which is Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of Israel assembled before the king at the feast that is in the seventh month.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the elders of Israel came, and the Levites took up the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought up the ark, the tent of assembly, and all the holy objects that were in the tent; the Levitical priests brought them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Solomon and the whole community of Israel that was assembled before him were before the ark, sacrificing sheep and cattle that could not be counted nor numbered for abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priests brought up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to its place in the inner sanctuary of the house, into the most holy place, underneath the wings of the cherubim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cherubim were spreading their wings over the place of the ark, so that the cherubim were covering the ark and over its poles from above.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the poles were so long that the ends of the poles from the ark were seen from before the inner sanctuary, but they could not be seen from the outside. And they are there until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was nothing in the ark but the two stone tablets that Moses had put inside at Horeb on which Yahweh had made a covenant with the Israelites when they went out from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the priests came out of the sanctuary (for all the priests who were present sanctified themselves without keeping their divisions)
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the Levitical singers—Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, their sons, their brothers, dressed in fine linen, with cymbals, harps, and stringed instruments—they were standing to the east of the altar. And with them outside were one hundred and twenty priests who were trumpet blowers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the primary duty of the trumpeters and singers to make themselves heard with one voice, to praise and give thanks to Yahweh. And when a sound from the trumpets, cymbals, and other instruments of song was raised to Yahweh—for he is good, because his loyal love is everlasting—then the house, the house of Yahweh, was filled with a cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priests were not able to stand to minister because of the cloud, for the glory of Yahweh filled the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon said, “Yahweh has decided to dwell in the deep gloom.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have built for you an exalted house, even a place for you to dwell in forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king turned around and blessed all the assembly of Israel, and all the assembly of Israel were standing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth with David my father, and with his hands he has fulfilled it, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘From the day that I brought my people out of the land of Egypt I did not choose a city among all the tribes of Israel to build a house in order for my name to be there. Nor did I choose a man to be leader over my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have chosen my name to be there in Jerusalem, and I have chosen David to be over my people Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh said to David my father, ‘Because it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: but you yourself will not build the house, but your son who will proceed from your loins; he himself will build the house for my name.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Yahweh has fulfilled his word that he spoke. I have risen in the place of David my father and am seated on the throne of Israel as Yahweh has spoken. I have built the house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have there the ark in which is the covenant of Yahweh that he made with the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon stood before the altar of Yahweh before all the assembly of Israel and spread out his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Solomon had made a platform of bronze five cubits long and five cubits wide and three cubits high, and placed it in the midst of the outer court.) And he stood upon it, then knelt down on his knees before the whole assembly of Israel and spread out his hands to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “O Yahweh, God of Israel, there is none like you, a God in the heavens and on the earth, keeping the covenant and loyal love with your servants who walk before you with all their heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you have kept for your servant David my father what you spoke to him. You spoke with your mouth, and by your hand you have fulfilled it on this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Yahweh, God of Israel, keep for your servant David, my father, what you have spoken to him, saying, ‘You shall not lack a man to sit on the throne of Israel before me, if only your sons keep their way, to walk in my law as you have walked before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Yahweh, God of Israel, let your word that you have spoken to your servant David be confirmed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But will God indeed dwell with humankind upon the earth? Look, the heavens and the highest heavens cannot contain you! Surely then this house that I have built will not contain you!
speaker: Narrator

text: But turn to the prayer of your servant and to his plea, O Yahweh my God, to hearken to the pleading and to the prayer that your servant is praying before you,
speaker: Narrator

text: that your eyes may be open day and night to this house, to the place that you have promised to place your name there, that you may hear the prayer that your servant has prayed to this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And listen to the pleas of your servant and your people Israel when they pray toward this place, that you yourself might hear from the place of your dwelling, from the heavens, that you might hear and forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man sins against his neighbor and makes him swear an oath and comes with an oath before your altar in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you yourself hear from the heavens and act and judge your servants, to repay the guilty by bringing his way upon his head and to vindicate the righteous by giving to him according to his righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And if your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against you and they repent and confess your name and pray and plead before you in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you yourself hear from the heavens and forgive the sin of your people Israel and again bring them back to the land that you gave to them and to their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the heavens are stopped up and there is no rain because they have sinned against you and they pray to this place and confess your name and turn back from their sin when you humble them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you yourself hear from the heavens and forgive the sin of your servants and your people Israel, when you teach them the good way in which they should walk, and give rain upon your land that you have given to your people as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is a famine in the land; if there is disease, blight, mildew, locust, and caterpillar; if it happens that his enemy lays siege to him in the land and his gates; any kind of plague, any kind of disease,
speaker: Narrator

text: then any prayer, any plea that is made by any person and by all your people Israel, each one who knows his own affliction and his own anguish and who spreads out his hands to this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you yourself hear from the heavens, your dwelling place, and forgive and give to each according to all his ways, since you know the heart of the children of humankind,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may fear you and walk in your ways all the days that they are alive upon the face of the land that you have given to our ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And also, with respect to the foreigner, he who is not of your people Israel, but comes from a distant land, for the sake of your great name and your powerful hand and outstretched arm, when he comes and prays to this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you yourself hear from the heavens, from your dwelling place, and do according to all that the foreigner asks of you, so that all peoples of earth will know of your name and fear you, as do your people Israel, and that they may know that your name possesses this house that I have built.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When your people go out to battle against their enemy according to the way that you have sent them, and they pray to you toward this city that you have chosen and the house that I have built for your name,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you hear their prayer and their pleas from the heavens and uphold their case.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they sin against you—for there is no person who does not sin—and you become angry with them and place them before their enemy that they carry them away as captives to a land far or near,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if they repent in the land where they were taken captive and repent and beg you for mercy in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned and acted perversely and done wickedly,
speaker: Narrator

text: and we return to you,’ with their whole heart and with all their inmost being in the land of their captivity where they took them captive, and if they pray toward their land that you have given to their ancestors and the city that you have chosen and to the house that I have built for your name,
speaker: Narrator

text: then may you hear their prayer and their pleas from the heavens, from your dwelling place, and uphold their case and forgive your people who sinned against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, O my God, please let your eyes be open and your ears attentive to the prayer of this place!
speaker: Narrator

text: “And now arise, O Yahweh God, to your resting place, you and the ark of your strength! O Yahweh God, let the priests be clothed with salvation, and let your holy ones rejoice in your goodness!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Yahweh God, do not turn away the face of your anointed one! Remember the loyal love of your servant, David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Solomon finished praying, then fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of Yahweh filled the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priests were not able to go into the house of Yahweh, for the glory of Yahweh had filled the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the Israelites saw the fire come down and the glory of Yahweh upon the house, they knelt down with their faces to the ground on the pavement and worshiped and gave thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loyal love is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king and all the people were offering a sacrifice before Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand cattle and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priests stood at their posts with the Levites, with the instruments of the song of Yahweh that King David had made to give thanks to Yahweh—for his loyal love is everlasting—whenever David offered praise by their hand. Now the priests sounded trumpets standing opposite them, and all Israel stood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon consecrated the middle of the courtyard that was before the house of Yahweh, for there he had made the burnt offerings and the fat of the fellowship offerings, for the bronze altar that Solomon had made was not able to hold the burnt offerings, cereal offerings, and the fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon held a feast at that time of seven days. And all Israel was with him, a very great assembly, from Lebo-Hamath to the river of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the eighth day they made a solemn assembly, for they held the dedication of the altar seven days and the feast seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents rejoicing and festive of heart on account of the goodness that Yahweh had done for David, Solomon, and Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon finished the house of Yahweh and the house of the king. And all that came into the heart of Solomon to do with respect to the house of Yahweh and his own house he accomplished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh appeared to Solomon at night and said to him, “I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for myself as a house of sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I hold back the heavens so that there is not rain, and when I command the locust to devour the earth, and if I send disease among my people,
speaker: Narrator

text: then if my people who are called by my name will humble themselves and will pray and will seek my face and will turn from their evil ways, then I myself shall hear from the heavens and will forgive their sins and heal their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now my eyes will be open and my ears attentive to the prayer of this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I have chosen and consecrated this house for my name to be there forever. My eyes and my heart will be there for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as for you, if you will walk before me as David your father walked and do according to all that I have commanded you and will keep my ordinances and judgments,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom as I promised to David your father, saying, ‘A man shall not be cut off for you from ruling over Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if you turn yourselves away and forsake my ordinances and my commandments which I have given before you all and will go and serve other gods and bow down to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will uproot them from upon my land that I have given to them, and this house that I have consecrated for my name I will send away from before my face, and I will make it a proverb and a taunt among all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for this house, which was exalted, all who pass by it will be appalled and will say, ‘Why has Yahweh done thus to this land and to this house?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will say, ‘Because they forsook Yahweh, the God of their ancestors, who brought them out from the land of Egypt, and they laid hold of other gods and worshiped them and served them. Therefore he has brought upon them all this evil.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that at the end of twenty years in which Solomon had built the house of Yahweh and his own house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon also built the cities that Huram had given to him, and he settled the Israelites in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon went to Hamath-Zobah and laid siege upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built Tadmor in the desert, and he built all the storage cities in Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also built Upper Beth-Horon and Lower Beth-Horon, fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars;
speaker: Narrator

text: Baalath and all the storage cities that belonged to Solomon; all the cities for chariots and cities for horses; and any desire of Solomon that he desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people who remained from the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites who were not from Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the descendants who were left over after them in the land, whom the Israelites had not destroyed, Solomon conscripted them as forced labor until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from the Israelites Solomon did not give as servants for his work, but they were men of war, his commanders of his officers, and commanders of his chariots and his horses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were the commanders of the garrisons that belonged to King Solomon, two hundred and fifty who exercised authority over the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh from the city of David to the house that he had built for her, for he said, “My wife shall not dwell in the house of David, king of Israel, for those places to which the ark of Yahweh has come are holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to Yahweh on the altar of Yahweh that he had built before the portico,
speaker: Narrator

text: as was the daily requirement, to offer up according to the commandments of Moses for Sabbaths, new moon festivals, and the three annual feasts: the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Booths.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in accord with the ordinance of David his father he appointed working groups of priests for their service, Levites for their responsibilities for praise and cultic service before the priests according to the daily requirement, and the gatekeepers in their working groups, gate by gate. For thus David the man of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did not turn aside from the commandment of the king concerning the priests and the Levites concerning anything, and concerning the treasury rooms.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon accomplished all the work from the day the foundation stone was laid for the house of Yahweh until its completion, and the house of Yahweh was finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon went to Ezion-Geber, and to Elath, on the edge of the sea in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huram sent to him, by the hand of his servants, ships and servants knowledgeable of the sea. And they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and from there they collected four hundred and fifty talents of gold and brought it to King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, and she came to Jerusalem to test Solomon with hard questions, with much wealth and camels, bearing spices and much gold and precious stones. And she came to Solomon and told him all that was on her mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon answered all her questions. Not a word was hidden from Solomon that he did not answer for her.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the queen of Sheba saw the wisdom of Solomon and the house he had built,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the food of his table, and the position of his officers, the duty of his servants and their clothing, his cupbearers and their clothing, and his burnt offerings that he offered at the house of Yahweh, there was no longer any breath in her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to the king, “The word which I heard in my land concerning your words and your wisdom is true,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I did not believe their words until I came and saw with my own eyes. And behold, half the greatness of your wisdom was not reported to me; you surpass the rumors that I had heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are your men, and blessed are these your servants who stand before you regularly and hear your wisdom!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be Yahweh your God who took delight in you, to put you on his throne as king for Yahweh your God! Because your God loved Israel, he established him forever and has put you over them as king to do justice and righteousness!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she gave to the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold and a very great amount of spices and precious stones. And there were no spices such as those that the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the servants of Hiram and the servants of Solomon who brought gold from Ophir brought algum wood and precious stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king made steps for the house of Yahweh and the house of the king, and lyres and harps for the singers from the algum wood. And there was not seen anything like them before in the land of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba every desired thing she asked, besides what she had brought to the king. Then she turned and went to her land, she and her servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that the weight of the gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: besides the gold and silver the traders and merchants brought, and all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the land brought.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Solomon made two hundred shields of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of beaten gold went into each shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made three hundred small shields of beaten gold; three hundred shekels went into each small shield. And the king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king made a large ivory throne and overlaid it with pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the throne had six steps, and a footstool of gold was attached to the throne. And there were armrests on each side. And by the seat were two lions standing beside the armrests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And twelve lions were standing there on each of the six steps on each end. And there was nothing like it made in all the kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the drinking vessels of King Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were of pure gold. Silver was not valued as anything in the days of Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the ships of the king went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram. Once every three years the ships of Tarshish came carrying gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus King Solomon was greater than all the kings of the earth in wealth and wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the kings of the earth sought the face of Solomon to hear his wisdom that God put in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And each of them brought his gifts, objects of silver, objects of gold, cloaks, myrrh, spices, horses, and mules, as an amount year by year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen. And he stationed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ruled over all the kings from the River to the land of the Philistines, to the boundary of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedar as the sycamore trees that are in the Shephelah for abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the horses were imported from Egypt and from all lands for Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the remainder of the words of Solomon from the first to the last, are they not written in the chronicles of Nathan the prophet and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer, concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon slept with his ancestors, and they buried him in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard it—now he was in Egypt, where he had fled from the presence of King Solomon—Jeroboam returned from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sent and called him. Then Jeroboam and all Israel went, and they spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Your father made our yoke heavy. Now, therefore, lighten the hard service of your father and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, and we will serve you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “In three days return to me again.” And the people went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Rehoboam took counsel with the elders who had been serving before Solomon his father when he was alive, saying, “What word do you advise to answer this people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, “If you will be good to this people and please them, then speak good words to them. Then they will be your servants forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he forsook the advice of the elders that advised him and took counsel of the young men who had grown up with him who were serving before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “What do you advise that we should say in return to this people, who said to me, ‘Lighten the yoke that your father has put upon us’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the young men who had grown up with him said to him, “Thus you should say to this people who have said to you, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, so you yourself should lighten it for us.’ Thus you should say to them, ‘My little finger is thicker than the loins of my father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, my father laid upon you a heavy yoke, but I myself will add to the yoke. My father disciplined you with whips, but I myself will do so with scorpions.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day as the king had spoken, saying, “Return to me on the third day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king answered them harshly, and King Rehoboam forsook the advice of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spoke to them according to the advice of the young men, saying, “I will make your yoke heavy, and I myself will add to it. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will do so with scorpions.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the king did not listen to the people, for it was a turning of events from God, so that Yahweh might fulfill his word that he had spoken by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel saw that the king would not listen to them, and the people answered the king, saying, “What portion is there for us in David? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse. Each to your tents, O Israel! Now look to your own house, David!” And all Israel went to their own tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for the Israelites who were living in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but the Israelites stoned him with stones, and he died. Then King Rehoboam hastily went up into the chariot to flee to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Israel has rebelled against the house of David until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, one hundred and eighty thousand chosen warriors, to fight against Israel to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of Yahweh came to Shemaiah, the man of God, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to Rehoboam, son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says Yahweh: “Do not go up, and do not fight against your brothers. Return, each man to his house, for this matter has come from me.”’” So they obeyed the words of Yahweh and turned back from going against Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem, and he built cities as strongholds in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built Bethlehem, Etah, Tekoa,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-Zur, Socoh, Adullam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, fortified cities that are in Judah and in Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he strengthened the fortifications and put commanders in them, along with stores of food, olive oil, and wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all the cities he put shields and spears, and he greatly strengthened them. So he had Judah and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the priests and the Levites who were throughout all Israel took their stand with him from all their territories.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Levites left their pasturelands and their property and came to Judah and to Jerusalem, for Jeroboam and his sons had rejected them from serving as priests to Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed his own priests for the high places and for the goat idols and for the bull calves that he had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after them, from all the tribes of Israel, those who set their heart to seek Yahweh, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to offer to Yahweh, the God of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they strengthened the kingdom of Judah and made Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, secure for three years, for they walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rehoboam took to himself as a wife Mahalath, the daughter of Yerimot son of David, and of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she bore to him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after her he took Maacah the daughter of Absalom, who bore to him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom more than all his wives and concubines (for he took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and he fathered twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah as chief and crown prince over his brothers, in order to make him king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dealt wisely and distributed some of his sons throughout all the land of Judah and Benjamin, through all the fortified cities, and gave abundant provisions to them and obtained many wives for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established and when he was strengthened, he forsook the law of Yahweh, and all Israel with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that in the fifth year of King Rehoboam (for they had acted unfaithfully against Yahweh), Shishak the king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text: with one thousand two hundred chariots and sixty thousand horsemen. And there was no number to the people who came up with him from Egypt—Libyans, Sukkites, and Cushites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the fortified cities that belonged to Judah, and he came up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam and the princes of Judah who had gathered at Jerusalem from before Shishak. And he said to them, “Thus says Yahweh: ‘You yourselves have abandoned me, and I myself have surely abandoned you into the hand of Shishak.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said, “Yahweh is righteous.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Yahweh saw that they humbled themselves, the word of Yahweh came to Shemaiah, saying, “They have humbled themselves; I will not destroy. I will give to them some way of escape, that my anger not be poured out against Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, they shall be his servants, that they might know my service and the service of the kingdoms of other countries.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and he took the treasures out of the house of Yahweh and the treasures out of the king’s house. He took everything. He also took the small shields of gold that Solomon had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Rehoboam made small shields of bronze in their place and committed them into the hand of the commanders of the guards who were keeping the entrance of the house of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whenever the king went into the house of Yahweh, the guards came and carried them, and then they returned them to the alcove of the guards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he humbled himself, the anger of Yahweh was turned away from him, so that he did not destroy the city completely. Moreover, matters were well in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So King Rehoboam was strengthened in Jerusalem, and he reigned there. Now, Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city where Yahweh had chosen to put his name out of all the tribes of Israel. And the name of his mother was Naamah the Ammonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did evil, for he did not set his heart to seek Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the words of Rehoboam from the first to the last, are they not written in the chronicles of Shemaiah the prophet and Iddo the seer as a record? And there were battles between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam slept with his ancestors, and he was buried in the city of David, and Abijah his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah reigned over Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. And the name of his mother was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel from Gibeah.
Now there was war between Abijah and between Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah joined in the battle with an army of four hundred thousand battle-hardened warriors, chosen men, and Jeroboam put the battle in order against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, an army of mighty warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abijah stood up on top of Mount Zemaraim that is in the hill country of Ephraim and said, “Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not all know that Yahweh the God of Israel gave the kingdom to David over Israel forever, to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jeroboam the son of Nebat, a servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up and rebelled against his master,
speaker: Narrator

text: and worthless men, sons of wickedness, were gathered about him and became hostile against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was a boy and gentle of heart and was not strong enough to stand before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now you yourselves are considering that you are strong before the kingdom of Yahweh which is in the hand the sons of David, since you yourselves are a great multitude and you have bull calves of gold that Jeroboam has made for idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did you not drive out the priests of Yahweh, the sons of Aaron, the Levites? Have you not made for yourselves priests like all the peoples of the lands? All who come to be consecrated for priestly service with a young bull or seven rams becomes a priest of what is not a god.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for us, Yahweh is our God, and we have not forsaken him. The priests serving Yahweh are the sons of Aaron, the Levites, according to their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: They offer burnt offerings to Yahweh every morning and every evening, sweet spices of incense, and the rows of bread upon the pure table. And the golden lampstand with its lamps they keep kindled every evening, for we are keeping the requirement of Yahweh our God, but you yourselves have forsaken him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And look, God is with us at the head, and his priests have the trumpets for sounding blasts against you, O sons of Israel. Do not fight against Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, for you will not succeed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeroboam sent around an ambush to come behind them. So they were in front of Judah, but the ambush was behind them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Judah turned, then behold, the battle against them was in front and behind, and they cried to Yahweh, and the priests blew on the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Judah shouted, and it happened that when the men of Judah were shouting, then God defeated Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites fled from before Judah, and God gave them into their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah and his people struck a great blow against them, and the dead from Israel that fell were five hundred thousand chosen men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites were subdued at that time, and the people of Judah were victorious, for they relied upon Yahweh the God of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam and took cities from him: Bethel with its villages, Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephron with its villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jeroboam did not regain strength again in the days of Abijah. And Yahweh plagued him and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abijah became strong, and he took to himself fourteen wives and fathered twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the words of Abijah and his ways and his words are written in the story of the prophet Iddo.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah slept with his ancestors, and they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son became king in his place. In his days the land was at rest ten years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Yahweh his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He removed the foreign altars and high places, broke down the stone pillars, and cut down the Asherahs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded Judah to seek Yahweh, the God of their ancestors, and to keep the law and the commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he removed the high places and the incense stands from all the cities of Judah, and the kingdom had rest under him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built fortified cities in Judah, for the land was at rest. Under him there was no war in those years, for Yahweh had given rest to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to Judah, “Let us build these cities and surround them with walls, towers, gates, and bars while the land is before us, because we have sought Yahweh our God. We have sought and he has given rest to us on every side.” So they built and had success.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa had an army of three hundred thousand from Judah, bearing shields and spears, and two hundred and eighty thousand from Benjamin who carried shields and drew bows. All of these were mighty warriors of strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerah the Cushite came out against them with an army of a thousand thousands and three hundred chariots. And he came to Mareshah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa went out before him, and a battle was put in order in the valley of Zepah at Mareshah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa cried out to Yahweh his God. And he said, “O Yahweh, there is none with you to help between the great and the powerless. Help us, O Yahweh our God, for we rely upon you, and in your name we have come against this multitude. O Yahweh, you are our God! Let no man prevail against you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh defeated the Cushites before Asa and before Judah, and the Cushites fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa and the army with him pursued them to Gerar. And many from the Cushites fell, for they had no deliverance, for they were shattered before Yahweh and before his army. And they carried away much war booty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they struck all the cities around Gerar, for the fear of Yahweh was upon them. And they plundered all the cities, for there was much plunder in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they also struck the tents of the herdsmen and carried away many sheep and camels. Then they returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Azariah the son of Oded—the Spirit of God came upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out before Asa and said to him, “Hear me, O Asa and all of Judah and Benjamin! Yahweh is with you while you are with him. And if you will seek him he will be found by you. But if you forsake him he will forsake you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Israel has been without the true God many days, and without a teaching priest, and without law,
speaker: Narrator

text: but at its trouble he returned to Yahweh, the God of Israel. They sought him, and he was found by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in those times there was no peace for the one going out and the one coming in, for great tumults were upon all the inhabitants of the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nation was crushed by nation, and city was against city, for God threw them into confusion by all sorts of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, be strong and let not your hands be weak, for there is reward for your labor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Asa heard these words, the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage and removed the vile idols from all the lands of Judah and Benjamin, and from the cities that he had taken in the hill country of Ephraim, and he repaired the altar of Yahweh that was in front of the portico of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin and those sojourning with them, from Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon, for many had deserted to him from Israel when they saw that Yahweh his God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were gathered at Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sacrificed to Yahweh on that day from the war booty they brought back: seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they entered into a covenant to seek Yahweh, the God of their ancestors, with all their heart and with all their inmost being,
speaker: Narrator

text: but all who will not seek Yahweh the God of Israel should be killed, from young to old, from men to women.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took an oath to Yahweh with a great voice, with shouting, with trumpets, and with horns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Judah rejoiced over the oath, for they swore with all their heart. And they sought him with their whole desire, and he was found by them, and Yahweh gave rest to them all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also Maacah, the mother of Asa, the king removed her from being queen, because she had made a repulsive image for Asherah. And Asa cut down her repulsive image, and he crushed and burned it at the Wadi Kidron.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the high places were not removed from Israel. Nevertheless, the heart of Asa was fully devoted all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought the holy objects of his father and his own holy objects into the house of God—silver and gold and vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was no war until the thirty-fifth year of the reign of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the thirty-sixth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha the king of Israel went up against Judah. And he built Ramah in order not to allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa, king of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa brought out silver and gold from the storehouses of the house of Yahweh and the house of the king, and he sent them to Ben-Hadad, king of Aram, who lived in Damascus, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “There is a covenant between me and you, as there was between my father and your father. Look, I am sending you silver and gold. Go, break your covenant with Baasha, king of Israel, that he might withdraw from me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ben-Hadad listened to King Asa, and he sent commanders of his troops that were with him against the cities of Israel. And they struck Ijon, Dan, Abel-Maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when Baasha heard this, he stopped building Ramah and ceased his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Asa took all of Judah, and they carried away the stones of Ramah and its timber with which Baasha had been building, and he built Geba and Mizpah with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah and said to him, “On account of your reliance upon the king of Aram, and since you did not rely on Yahweh your God, therefore the troops of the king of Aram escaped from your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Were not the Cushites and Libyans a mighty army with very abundant chariots and horsemen? And because of your reliance on Yahweh he gave them into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the eyes of Yahweh roam throughout all the earth to strengthen those whose heart is fully devoted to him. You have been foolish in this, for from now on you will have wars.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa was angry with the seer and put him in the prison, for he was enraged with him concerning this. And Asa oppressed some of the people at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now behold, the words of Asa from the first to the last, behold, they are written in the scroll of the kings of Judah and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the thirty-ninth year of his reign, he fell severely ill in his feet. But even in his illness he did not seek Yahweh, but only among the healers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa slept with his ancestors. And he died in the forty-first year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they buried him in his burial site, which had been cut out for him in the city of David. And they laid him on the bier which they had filled with all kinds of spices made by the perfumers as a fragment ointment. And they made a great fire in his honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and he strengthened himself against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put troops in all the fortified cities of Judah, and put garrisons in the land of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim that Asa his father had taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the former ways of David his father and did not seek after the Baals,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he sought after the God of his ancestors and walked in his commandments and not according to the works of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh established the kingdom in his hand. And all Judah gave tribute to Jehoshaphat, and he had much wealth and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his heart was courageous in the ways of Yahweh. Moreover, he removed the high places and the Asherahs from Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the third year of his reign he sent his officials, Ben-Hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them the Levites Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tob-Adonijah; and with them the priests Elisham and Joram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they taught in Judah, and the scroll of the law of Yahweh was with them when they went around in all the cities of Judah, and they taught the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fear of Yahweh was upon all the kingdoms of the lands surrounding Judah, and they did not make war against Jehoshaphat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the Philistines brought a gift and silver to Jehoshaphat as tribute. The Arabians also brought him seven thousand seven hundred sheep and seven thousand seven hundred goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat grew greater and greater, and he built fortresses and storage cities in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had many supplies in the cities of Judah and mighty warriors for battle in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were their enrollment by the house of their ancestors: of Judah, the commanders of thousands: Adnah, the commander, and with him were three hundred thousand mighty armed warriors;
speaker: Narrator

text: and at his side, Jehohanan the commander, and with him were two hundred and eighty thousand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and at his side, Amasiah the son of Zicri, who had made a freewill offering to Yahweh, and with him were two hundred thousand mighty armed warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from Benjamin: Eliada, a powerful mighty warrior, and with him were two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;
speaker: Narrator

text: and at his side, Jehozabad, and with him were one hundred and eighty thousand armed for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were serving the king, besides those whom the king had placed in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jehoshaphat had much wealth and honor, and he became son-in-law to Ahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after some years he went down to Ahab in Samaria. And Ahab slaughtered many sheep and cattle for him and for the people who were with him, and urged him to go up against Ramoth-Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, “Will you go up with me to Ramoth-Gilead?” And he answered him, “I am as you are, and my people are as your people with you in war.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Seek first of all the word of Yahweh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets, four hundred men. And he said to them, “Shall we go to Ramoth-Gilead to battle, or shall we cease?” And they said, “Go up, since God will give it into the hand of the king.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat said, “Is there not here another prophet of Yahweh that we might inquire of him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is yet one man by whom to seek Yahweh, but I hate him, because he never prophesies good concerning me, but always disaster. He is Micaiah the son of Imlah.” Then Jehoshaphat said, “Let not the king say thus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel called to a eunuch and said, “Quickly bring Micaiah the son of Imlah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were each sitting on his throne, clothed in robes. And they were sitting at the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria, and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zedekiah the son of Kenaanah made for himself horns of iron, and he said, “Thus says Yahweh: ‘With these you will gore Aram to their destruction.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the prophets prophesied thus, saying, “Go up to Ramoth-Gilead and triumph! Yahweh will give it into the hand of the king.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the messenger who went to call Micaiah said to him, “Behold, the words of the prophets are good with one voice to the king. Please let your word be as one with them and speak good.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Micaiah said, “As Yahweh lives, only what my God has said, that will I speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had come to the king, the king said to him, “Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-Gilead to war or shall I cease?” And he said, “Go up and triumph! They shall be given into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king said to him, “How many times shall I make you swear that you speak nothing except the truth in the name of Yahweh?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains like sheep that had no shepherd. And Yahweh said, ‘These have no masters; let them return to his own house in peace.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not say to you he would not prophesy good concerning me, but only disaster?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Micaiah said, “Therefore hear the word of Yahweh: I saw Yahweh sitting upon his throne with all the host of heaven standing on his right and on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said, ‘Who will entice Ahab the king of Israel that he would go up and fall at Ramoth-Gilead?’ And one said this, and another said that.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a spirit came forth and stood before Yahweh and said, ‘I will entice him.’ Then Yahweh said to him, ‘By what means?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, ‘I will go forth and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ And he said, ‘You will entice him and will also succeed. Go out and do so.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, behold, Yahweh has put a spirit of deception into the mouths of these your prophets. Yahweh has spoken disaster against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Zedekiah the son of Kenaanah came near and struck Micaiah on the cheek and said, “Which way did the Spirit of Yahweh come from me to speak to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Micaiah said, “Behold, you will see on that day when you go into a private room to hide yourself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah and return him to Amon the commander of the city and to Jehoash the son of the king,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, ‘Thus says the king: “Put this one into the prison house, and let him eat a meager ration of bread and water until I return in peace.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Micaiah said, “If you surely return in peace Yahweh has not spoken with me.” Then he said, “Hear, peoples, all of them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth-Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you, wear your garments.” So the king of Israel disguised himself, and they went to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the king of Aram had commanded the commanders of his chariots, saying, “Do not fight with the small or the great, but only with the king of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when the commanders of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, then they said, “It is the king of Israel!” And they turned against him to fight. Then Jehoshaphat cried out and Yahweh helped him. God drove them away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when the commanders of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back from following him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a certain man drew the bow at random and struck the king of Israel between the soldering of his breastplate armor. Then he said to the chariot driver, “Turn around; get me away from the war camp, for I am wounded.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the battle went on that day, and the king of Israel was propped up in the chariot facing Aram until the evening. And he died at the time of the going down of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehu son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him. And he said to King Jehoshaphat, “Should you be a help to the wicked and love those who hate Yahweh? On account of this, wrath has come against you from Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless some good things have been found in regard to you, for you burned the Asherahs out of the land and set your heart to seek God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem and returned and went out among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim and brought them back to Yahweh, the God of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed judges in the land and in all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the judges, “Consider what you are doing, for you are not judging for a man but for Yahweh. Now he is with you in speaking justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, let the fear of Yahweh be upon you all. Be careful what you do, for there is neither wickedness nor showing partiality and taking bribes with Yahweh our God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, Jehoshaphat appointed in Jerusalem some of the Levites and the priests and heads of the families of Israel as judges and to decide legal disputes for Yahweh. And they sat in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them, saying, “Thus you must do in the fear of Yahweh in faithfulness and with a whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Any legal dispute that comes before you from your brothers who live in their cities concerning bloodguilt, law, commandment, statutes, and justice, you must warn them, so that they do not incur guilt before Yahweh, and that wrath may not come upon you and your brothers. Thus you must do that you do not incur guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of the word of Yahweh, and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the governor of the house of Judah, in all matters of the king, and the Levites shall be before you as officials. Be strong and do well! May Yahweh be with the upright.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that afterward, the Moabites, the Ammonites, and some of the Meunites came against Jehoshaphat for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came and reported it to Jehoshaphat, saying, “A great multitude from beyond the sea, from Aram, is coming against you. Now behold, they are in Hazazon Tamar” (that is, En Gedi).
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat was afraid and set his face to seek Yahweh. And he called for a fast through all Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah assembled to seek after Yahweh; even from all the cities of Judah they came to seek Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem in the house of Yahweh before the new courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “O Yahweh, God of our ancestors, are you not God in heaven? Now you rule in all the kingdoms of the nations, and in your hand are power and might, and there is none who can resist against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, our God, did you yourself not drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel and give it to the descendants of Abraham your friend forever?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lived in it and built for you a sanctuary for your name in it, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If disaster, a sword, punishment, disease, or famine come upon us, we shall stand before this house and before you—for your name is in this house—and cry out to you out of our trouble, then you will hear and save us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, look, the people of Moab and Ammon and Mount Seir whom you did not allow Israel to come against when they came from Egypt, from whom they turned aside and did not destroy,
speaker: Narrator

text: now behold, they are rewarding us by coming to dispossess us from your possession which you gave us as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: O our God, will you not judge them, for there is no power in us before this great multitude that is coming against us. Now we do not know what we shall do, for our eyes are upon you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Judah was standing before Yahweh, and also their little children, their wives, and their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came upon Jahaziel, the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite from the descendants of Asaph, in the midst of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Listen, all Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem and King Jehoshaphat, thus says Yahweh to you: ‘Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed before this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tomorrow go down against them. Behold, they are coming up the ascent of Ziz. And you will find them at the end of the valley facing the desert of Jeruel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be no need for you to fight in this battle. Take your stand! Stand and see the deliverance of Yahweh among you, O Judah and Jerusalem! Do not fear and do not be dismayed. Tomorrow go out before them and Yahweh will be with you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat bowed his face down to the ground, and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell before Yahweh to worship Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Levites, from the Kohathites and from the Korahites stood up to praise Yahweh the God of Israel with an exceedingly loud voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they rose up early in the morning and went out to the desert of Tekoa. And when they went out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Hear me, O Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! Believe in Yahweh your God, and you shall be established! Believe in his prophets, and you shall succeed!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed singers to Yahweh who were giving praise to the splendor of his holiness when they went out before the army. And they said, “Give thanks to Yahweh, for his loyal love is everlasting!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they began with singing and praise, Yahweh set ambushes against the people of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir who were coming against Judah. And they were defeated
speaker: Narrator

text: when the people of Ammon and Moab rose up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir to destroy and demolish them. And when the inhabitants of Seir had made an end of them, each helped to destroy his comrade.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah came against the watchtower of the wilderness. And they looked at the crowd, and behold, corpses were lying on the ground. There was none who had escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jehoshaphat came with his people to plunder their booty, they found among them in abundance possessions, corpses, and precious items. And they took plunder for themselves until they could carry no more. And they were three days in plundering the booty, for it was abundant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the fourth day, they assembled in the Valley of Berakah, for there they blessed Yahweh. Therefore the name of that place is called the Valley of Berakah up to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of Judah and Jerusalem returned, and Jehoshaphat was at their head in returning to Jerusalem with joy, for Yahweh caused them to rejoice over their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jerusalem with harps, stringed instruments, and trumpets to the house of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fear of God came upon all the kingdoms of the earth when they heard that Yahweh had fought against the enemies of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the kingdom of Jehoshaphat was at rest, since his God gave rest to him all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign. And he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he walked in the way of his father Asa and did not turn aside from it, to do what was right in the eyes of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the high places were not removed. The people still had not yet set their heart on the God of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the words of Jehoshaphat, from the first to the last, behold, they are written in the chronicles of Jehu the son of Hanani, which are recorded in the scroll of the kings of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward Jehoshaphat the king of Judah joined with Ahaziah the king of Israel, who acted wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined with him to build ships to go to Tarshish. And they built the ships in Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, “Because of your joining with Ahaziah, Yahweh will break down your works.” And the ships were destroyed and were not able to go to Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat slept with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David, and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, and Shephatiah. All these were the sons of Jehoshaphat, king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their father gave to them many gifts of silver, gold, and valuables, with fortified cities in Judah, but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram, for he was the firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jehoram ascended to the kingdom of his father, he strengthened himself and murdered all his brothers with the sword, and even some of the princes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel as the house of Ahab had done, for the daughter of Ahab was his wife. And he did evil in the sight of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh was not willing to destroy the house of David on account of the covenant that he had made with David and since he had promised to give a lamp to him and to his descendants forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and they set up a king of their own.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoram passed over with his commanders and all the chariots with him, and when night came he struck Edom who was all around him and the commanders of his chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah until this day. Then Libnah also revolted at that time from under his hand, because he had forsaken Yahweh, the God of his ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made high places in the hill country of Judah, and he enticed the inhabitants of Jerusalem to be unfaithful, and he led Judah astray.
speaker: Narrator
